title: Examples for using `theme_mengbo` when generating ggplots
code: library(ggthemeML) library(scales)

title: Examples for using `theme_mengbo` when generating ggplots
code: names(ggthemeML:::mengbo_palettes)  [1] "main"             "cool"             "hot"              "pastel"           "light"             [6] "grey"             "opposite"         "opposite_ordinal" "wehi_full"        "wehi_light"       [11] "wehi_dark"        "wehi_mix"         show_col(mengbo_pal("main")(8)) show_col(mengbo_pal("cool")(4)) show_col(mengbo_pal("hot")(4)) show_col(mengbo_pal("pastel")(8)) show_col(mengbo_pal("light")(8)) show_col(mengbo_pal("grey")(5)) show_col(mengbo_pal("opposite")(6)) show_col(mengbo_pal("opposite_ordinal")(6)) show_col(mengbo_pal("wehi_full")(9)) show_col(mengbo_pal("wehi_light")(8)) show_col(mengbo_pal("wehi_dark")(8)) show_col(mengbo_pal("wehi_mix")(16)) show_col(mengbo_pal("main")(16))

title: Examples for using `theme_mengbo` when generating ggplots
text: ggplot theme modified based default ggplot theme (theme_grey()). Modifications include removing minor grids, bigger axis texts, empty panel legend background .

title: Examples for using `theme_mengbo` when generating ggplots
code: mtcars2 <- within(mtcars, {   vs <- factor(vs, labels = c("V-shaped", "Straight"))   am <- factor(am, labels = c("Automatic", "Manual"))   cyl  <- factor(cyl)   gear <- factor(gear) })  p1 <- ggplot(mtcars2) +   geom_point(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = gear)) +   labs(     title = "Fuel economy declines as weight increases",     subtitle = "(1973-74)",     caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine.",     tag = "Figure 1",     x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     y = "Fuel economy (mpg)",     colour = "Gears"   ) p1 + theme_mengbo() p1 + facet_wrap(~ gear) +  theme_mengbo() p1 + scale_color_mengbo("main") + theme_mengbo()

title: Examples for using `theme_mengbo` when generating ggplots
code: p1 + theme_mengbo(clean_background = FALSE) p1 + facet_wrap(~ gear) + theme_mengbo(clean_background = FALSE)

title: Examples for using `theme_mengbo` when generating ggplots
code: ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Sepal.Length)) +   geom_point(size = 4) +   scale_color_mengbo("main", discrete = FALSE) +    theme_mengbo()

what: Return function to interpolate a mengbo color palette — mengbo_pal
title: Return function to interpolate a mengbo color palette — mengbo_pal
text: function gets pallete name list ("main" default), boolean condition determining whether reverse order , additional arguments pass colorRampPallete() (alpha value).

title: Return function to interpolate a mengbo color palette — mengbo_pal
code: mengbo_pal(palette = "main", reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Return function to interpolate a mengbo color palette — mengbo_pal
text: palette Character name palette mengbo_palettes reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed ... Additional arguments pass colorRampPalette()

title: Return function to interpolate a mengbo color palette — mengbo_pal
Return function to interpolate a mengbo color palette — mengbo_pal
text: Changes new color palettes added list.

title: Return function to interpolate a mengbo color palette — mengbo_pal
code: mengbo_pal("main", alpha = 0.8) #> function (n)  #> { #>     x <- ramp(seq.int(0, 1, length.out = n)) #>     if (ncol(x) == 4L)  #>         rgb(x[, 1L], x[, 2L], x[, 3L], x[, 4L], maxColorValue = 255) #>     else rgb(x[, 1L], x[, 2L], x[, 3L], maxColorValue = 255) #> } #> <bytecode: 0x55d7b7cbe0f8> #> <environment: 0x55d7b7cec7d0> mengbo_pal("cool")(10) #>  [1] "#884EC7" "#6854C2" "#495ABD" "#2A61B8" "#3873AB" "#48869E" "#579992" #>  [8] "#55A78D" "#53B588" "#52C484"

what: Color scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_color_mengbo
title: Color scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_color_mengbo
Color scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_color_mengbo
code: scale_color_mengbo(palette = "main", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Color scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_color_mengbo
text: palette Character name palette mengbo_palettes discrete Boolean indicating whether color aesthetic discrete reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed ... Additional arguments passed discrete_scale() scale_color_gradientn(), used respectively discrete

title: Color scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_color_mengbo
code: # Color by discrete variable using default palette ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Species)) + geom_point(size = 4) + scale_color_mengbo()  # Color by numeric variable with cool palette ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Sepal.Length)) + geom_point(size = 4) + scale_color_mengbo(discrete = FALSE, palette = "cool")

what: Fill scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_fill_mengbo
title: Fill scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_fill_mengbo
Fill scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_fill_mengbo
code: scale_fill_mengbo(palette = "main", discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Fill scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_fill_mengbo
text: palette Character name palette mengbo_palettes discrete Boolean indicating whether color aesthetic discrete reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed ... Additional arguments passed discrete_scale() scale_fill_gradientn(), used respectively discrete TRUE FALSE

title: Fill scale constructor for mengbo colors — scale_fill_mengbo
code: # Fill by discrete variable with different palette + remove legend (guide) ggplot(mpg, aes(manufacturer, fill = manufacturer)) + geom_bar() + theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) + scale_fill_mengbo(palette = "main", guide = "none")

what: Plotting theme modified from theme_bw — theme_mengbo
title: Plotting theme modified from theme_bw — theme_mengbo
Plotting theme modified from theme_bw — theme_mengbo
code: theme_mengbo(   base_size = 14,   base_family = "",   base_line_size = base_size/20,   base_rect_size = base_size/20,   clean_background = TRUE )

title: Plotting theme modified from theme_bw — theme_mengbo
text: base_size base font size, given pts base_family base font family base_line_size base size line elements base_rect_size base size rect elements clean_background Logical, whether keep grid guidelines

title: Plotting theme modified from theme_bw — theme_mengbo
text: `theme_mengbo()` Mengbo's ggplot theme modified classic dark--light ggplot2 theme.

title: Plotting theme modified from theme_bw — theme_mengbo
code: mtcars2 <- within(mtcars, {   vs <- factor(vs, labels = c("V-shaped", "Straight"))   am <- factor(am, labels = c("Automatic", "Manual"))   cyl  <- factor(cyl)   gear <- factor(gear) })  p1 <- ggplot(mtcars2) +   geom_point(aes(x = wt, y = mpg, colour = gear)) +   labs(     title = "Fuel economy declines as weight increases",     subtitle = "(1973-74)",     caption = "Data from the 1974 Motor Trend US magazine.",     # tag = "Figure 1",     x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     y = "Fuel economy (mpg)",     colour = "Gears"   )  p1 + theme_mengbo()
